etymology.description: phonetic 殸(殸) (kēng, "stone chime") + semantic 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") = sound heard by the ear -> stone chime
etymology.interpretation: The character 聲(shēng, "stone chime") combines the phonetic element 殸(殸) (kēng, "stone chime") with 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") to represent sounds, specifically the sound of a stone chime as heard by the ear.
etymology.simplification: 声 is a simplified and variant form of 聲, retaining the primary phonetic and semantic elements.

examples.chinese: 古寺中传来石制聲的回响(古寺中傳來石製聲的回響)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ sì zhōng chuán lái shí zhì shēng de huí xiǎng.
examples.english: The echo of the stone chime came from the ancient temple.

examples.chinese: 夜深时(夜深時)，山谷中传出石制聲的旋律(山谷中傳出石製聲的旋律)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn shí, shān gǔ zhōng chuán chū shí zhì shēng de xuán lǜ.
examples.english: At night, a melody from the stone chime echoed through the mountain valley.
